definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

sentences.english: The guests were all in the dining room now, sitting down to their excess of appetizers.
sentences.chinese: 客人们现在都坐在餐厅里，吃开了他们奢华的开胃菜。

sentences.english: I can still taste the pickled chicken feet and mushroom appetizers.
sentences.chinese: 我还尝过腌过的鸡爪和蘑菇开胃菜。

sentences.english: Serving multiple appetizers and finger foods cuts down on your work.
sentences.chinese: 提供多种开胃菜和能减少你工作量的手抓食物。

sentences.english: For appetizer my wife will have smoked salmon, but I preferashrimp cocktail.
sentences.chinese: 我太太要熏鲑鱼作开胃菜，但是我想要虾子。

sentences.english: The tradition of serving starters or hors d'oeuvres is said to have arisen in Russia.
sentences.chinese: 上开胃菜或餐前小点心的传统据说起源于俄罗斯。

sentences.english: Bring your own healthy entrée or appetizer to the party.
sentences.chinese: 自带你的健康主食或者开胃菜去聚会。

sentences.english: Next time when you have dinner in an Italian restaurant, order yourself prosciutto with cantaloupe to start the meal.
sentences.chinese: 下次去意大利餐厅时，点一份火腿哈密瓜开胃菜。

sentences.english: Bring these colorful, bite-sized appetizers to your holiday parties. You can keep the fact that they are healthy a secret!
sentences.chinese: 把这些五颜六色，一口大小的开胃菜到您的假日聚会。
我想要一份开胃菜与荤菜。

sentences.english: Now the combination serves as one of the most popular appetizers and snacks.
sentences.chinese: 现在这种组合也成了最流行的开胃菜和甜点之一。

sentences.english: But cardio is just the beginning of how far a fighter will go to get that edge.
sentences.chinese: 但是心肺训练只是格斗士超越极限的开胃菜。
我负责的部分是开胃菜。

sentences.english: This healthy appetizer includes all the colors of Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 这道健康的开胃菜包含圣诞的所有颜色。

sentences.english: Well, we order appetizers first and then entrees .
sentences.chinese: 嗯，我们先点开胃菜然后再点主餐。

sentences.english: Some meals may include appetizers, soup or salad before the main course.
sentences.chinese: 在主菜之前，有些聚餐会上开胃菜，汤品或者沙拉。

sentences.english: A simple appetizer, ceviche, was overcomplicated.
sentences.chinese: 橙汁腌鱼这一道简单的开胃菜做得太过复杂。

definition: appetizer/small side dish/easy job/piece of cake/see also 小菜一碟[xiao3 cai4 yi1 die2]
a dish that goes well with alcoholic drinks
signature dish/a restaurant’s most famous dish
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor
to smell, look and taste great
